alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 09 at 3:37PM PDT until September 09 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 335 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated stream gauges indicated elevated flows in the New River and its tributary streams. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in both Mexico and in Imperial County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Plaster City, Ocotillo, Westmorland, El Centro Naval Airfield, Mt. Signal, Mountain Spring, Dixieland, Seeley, Coyote Wells and Heber. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
